respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

div.head: Act 1, Chorus 1
div.stage: Enter GOWER.
Before the palace of Antioch.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Antioch. A room in the palace.
Enter ANTIOCHUS, PRINCE PERICLES, and followers.

l.stage: Takes hold of the hand of the Princess.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Tyre. A room in the palace.
Enter PERICLES.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Tyre. An ante-chamber in the Palace.
Enter THALIARD.

sp.speaker: Thaliard
sp.stage: Enter HELICANUS and ESCANES, with other Lords of Tyre.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
Enter CLEON, the governor of Tarsus, with DIONYZA, and others.

div.head: Act 2, Chorus 1
div.stage: Enter GOWER.

l.stage: Enter at one door PERICLES talking with CLEON; all the train with them. Enter at another door a Gentleman, with a letter to PERICLES; PERICLES shows the letter to CLEON; gives the Messenger a reward, and knights him.
Exit PERICLES at one door, and CLEON at another.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Pentapolis. An open place by the seaside.
Enter PERICLES, wet.

sp.speaker: First Fisherman
sp.stage: Re-enter Second and Third Fishermen, drawing up a net.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 2
div.stage: The same. A public way or platform leading to the lists. A pavilion by the side of it for the reception of the King, Princess, Lords, c.
Enter SIMONIDES, THAISA, Lords and Attendants.

l.stage: Enter a Knight; he passes over, and his Squire presents his shield to the Princess.
The Sixth Knight, Pericles, passes over.
Great shouts within, and all cry âThe mean knight!â

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
Enter SIMONIDES, THAISA, Lords, Attendants, and Knights, from tilting.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
Enter HELICANUS and ESCANES.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 5
div.stage: Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
Enter SIMONIDES, reading a letter, at one door: the Knights meet him.

sp.speaker: Gower
sp.stage: Enter, PERICLES and SIMONIDES, at one door, with Attendants; a Messenger meets them, kneels, and gives PERICLES a letter: PERICLES shows it SIMONIDES; the Lords kneel to him. Then enter THAISA with child, with LYCHORIDA a nurse. The KING shows her the letter; she rejoices: she and PERICLES takes leave of her father, and depart with LYCHORIDA and their Attendants.
Then exeunt SIMONIDES and the rest.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter PERICLES, on shipboard.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Ephesus. A room in Cerimon's house.
Enter CERIMON, with a Servant, and some Persons who have been shipwracked.

l.stage: Enter two or three Servants with a chest.
Re-enter a Servant, with boxes, napkins, and fire.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: Tarsus. A room in Cleon's house.
Enter PERICLES, CLEON, DIONYZA, and LYCHORIDA with MARINA in her arms.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 4
div.stage: Ephesus. A room in Cerimon's house.
Enter CERIMON and THAISA.

div.head: Act 4, Chorus 1
div.stage: Enter GOWER.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
Enter DIONYZA and LEONINE.

l.stage: Enter MARINA, with a basket of flowers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
Enter PANDAR, Bawd, and BOULT.

sp.speaker: Pandar
sp.stage: Re-enter BOULT, with the Pirates and MARINA.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Tarsus. A room in Clean's house.
Enter CLEON and DIONYZA.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter GOWER, before the monument of MARINA at Tarsus.

sp.speaker: Gower
sp.stage: Enter PERICLES, at one door, with all his train; CLEON and DIONYZA, at the other.
CLEON shows PERICLES the tomb; whereat PERICLES makes lamentation, puts on sack-cloth,
and in a mighty passion departs. Then exeunt CLEON and DIONYZA.

l.stage: Reads the inscription on Marina's monument.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: Mytilene. A street before the brothel.
Enter, from the brothel, two Gentlemen.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 6
div.stage: The same. A room in the brothel.
Enter Pandar, Bawd, and BOULT.

div.head: Act 5, Chorus 1
div.stage: Enter GOWER.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: On board Pericles' ship, off Mytilene. A close pavilion on deck, with a curtain before it; Pericles within it, reclined on a couch. A barge lying beside the Tyrian vessel.
Enter two Sailors, one belonging to the Tyrian vessel, the other to the barge; to them HELICANUS.

l.stage: The Gentlemen and the two Sailors descend, and go on board the barge.
Enter, from thence, LYSIMACHUS and Lords; with the Gentlemen and the two Sailors.
Whispers a Lord, who goes off in the barge of Lysimachus.
Re-enter, from the barge, Lord, with MARINA and a young Lady.
DIANA appears to PERICLES as in a vision.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter GOWER, before the temple of DIANA at Ephesus.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: The temple of Diana at Ephesus; THAISA standing near the altar, as high priestess; a number of Virgins on each side; CERIMON and other Inhabitants of Ephesus attending.
Enter PERICLES, wlith his train; LYSIMACHUS, HELICANUS, MARINA, and a Lady.

div.head: Act 5, Chorus 2
div.stage: Enter GOWER.
